Description: Biconical pottery bowl made of Nile silt clay, with rounded base, angular transition to walls and sides drawing in towards the rim, coated with red slip and burnished on both the interior and exterior with faint indications of rippling in places; the rim is milled. Two perforations beneath rim were for mending in antiquity, the once broken piece has been filled during restoration.
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (pl. xv. 9M)
Condition: fair (heavily restored), slip not adhering well to walls.
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
